alert.note: Alert for Kershaw (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 8:41PM EST until January 15 at 8:56PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Wateree River Near Camden affecting Kershaw County. Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties. Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Calhoun, Lexington and Richland Counties. Pee Dee River At Cheraw affecting Chesterfield and Marlboro Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Saluda River At Chappells affecting Newberry, Greenwood and Saluda Counties. Wateree River At Lake Wateree affecting Fairfield, Kershaw and Lancaster Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Wateree River near Camden. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Access road in the Wild Turkey Lane Community near Camden becomes flooded. River bottomland between Camden and Lugoff begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Sunday the stage was 27.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 27.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage overnight and continue falling to 23.0 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 845 AM EST.
